title: Paulo Dybala reveals he never wanted to join Manchester United or Tottenham
text:
Paulo Dybala has revealed he had no desire to join Manchester United or Tottenham this summer.

The Juventus forward was heavily linked with a move to England with suggestions there would be no place for him in Maurizio Sarri's team as he took over in Turin.

But speaking to Corriere della Sera, Dybala admits he feels a weight has been lifted off his shoulders with the window closed and he can 'let the pitch do the talking' now.

Paulo Dybala admits he had no desire to join Manchester United or Tottenham this summer

The Argentine stuck to his plan to remain at Juventus and is beginning to thrive in the side

'It wasn't an easy summer,' he said. 'Hearing your name linked to every team and every place, where you don't want to go, isn't a nice thing. But this is football, even if before the transfer window opened I said: "I want to stay here."

'I think it was more important to let the pitch do the talking, even if until the last day no-one knew what would happen. I wanted to stay, I wanted to play here and continue my career at Juve.

'I think I can still give a lot and I showed a glimpse of that against Inter.

Dybala is working hard to improve under Maurizio Sarri as the Italian gives him instructions

'I feel less weight on my shoulders and very calm mentally. I was convinced that with Sarri, I'd start to have fun, work and prove what I'm worth. And that's what I'm trying to do.'

Sarri made it clear when he arrived that Dybala was one of the players he was keen to develop and the 25-year-old showed he is beginning to thrive under the Italian as he netted the opener against Inter Milan in the Derby D'Italia.

Dybala collected a ball over the top by Miralem Pjanic and with Inter defender Milan Skriniar backtracking, Dybala produced a rocket with his left foot to make it 1-0, opening his account for the season.
description: The Juventus forward was heavily linked with a move to England with suggestions there would be no place for him in Maurizio Sarri's team as he took over in Turin but he stayed and is thriving.
